sect1.title: ISVALID

row.entry: The name of a DECIMAL, REAL, or alien data TYPE field.
ISVALID returns a single Boolean value.

sect1.para: The ISVALID function validates that the field contains a legal value. If the contents are not valid for the declared value type of the field (such as hexadecimal values greater than 9 in a DECIMAL), ISVALID returns FALSE, otherwise it returns TRUE.
sect1.programlisting: MyVal := IF(ISVALID(Infile.DecimalField),Infile.DecimalField,0); //ISVALID returns TRUE if the value is legal
sect1.para: See Also: TYPE Structure, DECIMAL, REAL
